current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize
		  programs under part A of title XI of such Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Newborn Screening Saves Lives
			 Reauthorization Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Newborn Screening Saves Lives Reauthorization Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited

The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.

Sec. 2. Improved newborn and child screening and follow-up for
				heritable disorders.

Sec. 3. Evaluating the effectiveness of newborn and child
				screening and follow-up programs.

Sec. 4. Advisory Committee on Heritable Disorders in Newborns
				and Children.

Sec. 5. Clearinghouse of Newborn Screening
				Information.

Sec. 7. Interagency Coordinating Committee on Newborn and Child
				Screening.

Sec. 8. National contingency plan for newborn
				screening.

header.#text: GAO report on timeliness of newborn screening

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit a report to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States
Committee on Health, Education, Labor and Pensions of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: concerning the timeliness of screening for heritable disorders in newborns.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives

text.#text: Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Newborn Screening Saves Lives Reauthorization Act of 2013/s:11/ss:a/p:1

text.#text: An analysis of information regarding the timeliness of newborn screening, which may include the time elapsed from birth to specimen collection, specimen collection to receipt by laboratory, specimen receipt to reporting, reporting to follow-up testing, and follow-up testing to confirmed diagnosis.
A summary of any guidelines, recommendations, or best practices available to States and health care providers intended to support a timely newborn screening system.
An analysis of any barriers to maintaining a timely newborn screening system which may exist and recommendations for addressing such barriers.
